contextId.information: Foxes are animals like dogs. They eat nesting birds and other small animals. If foxes are unknown in your area, use a general term for dog-like creatures or other furry animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This refers to wine that has not fermented yet. If grapes are unknown in your area, use the general term for fruit. AT: "grape juice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
a place to plant grain. If wheat is unknown and "grain" is too general, then you can use "fields of the plant they made bread from." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

A "pearl" is a smooth, hard, shiny, white or light-colored bead formed inside mollusks in the sea and highly prized as a gem or to make into valuable jewelry. AT: "fine pearls" or "beautiful pearls" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
These are various leaves and seeds people used to make food taste good. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
a female chicken. You can translate with any bird that protects her children under her wing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a costly container made of soft stone. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
